result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Kabu Bugembe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: With sentence in case 16cf194 and any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
*The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/ extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
*Pay all court costs, assessments and surcharges.
*Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
*The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor. The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
*Obtain Mental Health Assessment and comply with treatment.

*ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: To any other sentence.
**06/12/17-Judge Janet Protasiewicz**
JOC shall be amended to state that count two is consecutive to any other sentence. The language "Count 1 and" shall be deleted.

*Count one conditions apply.
**06/23/17- Judge Janet Protasiewicz**
The JOC shall be amended to clarify that Count two is an imposed and stayed sentence with ONE year of probation. All other sentencing orders remain in effect. A copy of the amended judgment shall be reported to the DOC.

Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. mag
Original transcript (excerpt) of sentencing hearing in 14CF000245 and 16CF000194.
Request for sentencing transcript excerpt sent to Court Reporter Risa Kramer.  SPC
Letter from defendant seeking clarification of sentence.
/AMENDING Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.  mn
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify sentence on count two.

Defendant Christopher Kabu Bugembe in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Defendant Christopher Kabu Bugembe in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 42 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, to run consecutive with sentence in case 16 cf194 and any other sentence.
AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 1 and any other sentence.

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS, Concurrent with case 16 cf 194.

Conditions of probation include:
-Serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with work release if employed.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/ extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-Obtain Mental Health Assessment and comply with treatment.
-Seek and maintain full-time employment.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.
IF REVOKED:  
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.     
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
             Notice of Ineligible Voting

Court ordered charge Orally amended to Possession of Narcotic Drugs,961.41(3g)(am), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes  section(s) , a Class  F

Defendant Christopher Kabu Bugembe in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Defendant Christopher Kabu Bugembe in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

At the hour of 10:33am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict:

As to Count 1 Found Guilty as to the lesser included charge of possession of controlled substance heroin, which was read.

As to Count 2  - Found Guilty to Count 2  which was read.

Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed. 

At the hour of 10:50am jury dismissed for the day.

Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict .  
Court granted defense motion . Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  


Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on April 12, 2017 at 8:30am, branch 24
received and filed.

CASE RECALLED. SAME APPEARANCES
Jury in Box at 1:38. 
Witness sworn for State:  Ryan Dewitt ( City of Milwaukee Police Officer).
Jurors Questions placed on the record..
Witness sworn for the State: James Henner (Detective for City of Milwaukee). Exhibit #16 received.
State rests subject to rebuttal. Jury out of box at 2:56pm. Side bar placed on the record.  
Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right to testify.
Jury in box at 3:25pm. State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  
Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  
Jury retired at the hour of 4:18pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies  who were duly sworn for that purpose.
Jury in box at 4:45pm. Jurors dismissed for today and instructed to return to court 03-01-20107 at 9:00am to deliberate.

Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Jason Dewitt ( City of Milwaukee Police Officer). Exhibits  1-10 received and published to the jurors. Exhibits 11 received. 
Jury out of box at 10:04am for short break. in Chambers discussion placed on the record. Jury in box at 10:23am. Testimony of Jason Dewitt Continues.
Jurors Questions placed on the record. State Witness sworn: Lee Vedbraalen ( City of Milwaukee Police Officer); Meghann McMahan ( Wisconsin Crime Lab Analyst).
Juror out of box at 11:40 for lunch break and instructed to return at 1:15pm. to Branch 24.

CASE RECALLED. SAME APPEARANCES.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire continued at the hour of  2:05pm  

Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  
Court ordered witnesses sequestered. Jury out of box at 2:16pm. Court placed strikes for causes on the record.

Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state. Defense reserves his opening statement. 
Court dismisses jury for today and instructs them return on February 28, 2015 at 8:15am, Branch 24.
